GenericBox examples

example1: Fixed position

This is the simplest example. It shows the popup on a fixed position. See the css for the code.

This is a simple example...

The popup is at a fixed position on the screen

example2: Center screen

Flexbox can be used to center the popup horizontally and vertically on the screen. (Chrome 21+, Safari 6.1+, Firefox 22+, Opera 12.1, IE 11+, Android 4.4+, iOS 7.1+)
Other centering methods can be used to support older browsers.

With flexbox

We can finally easily center horizontally and vertically

example3: Full screen

The popup can also fill up the whole screen.

Full screen content

Resizing the browser will also resize the popup, without any javascript.

example4: Common scenario (simple animation)

In most cases, a centered box with a simple fading animation makes the popup less aggressive.

Simple animations

Makes a smooth transition

example5: Multiple popup

Multiple popups are supported by default. You can also specify a z-index if needed.

And since everything is css...

z-index can be specified if needed.

Click on the overlay also

Notice how the esc key works

example6: Custom styles

Everything is customizable. You only need to know css. See the css for the code.

Freedom !!

  • You can style the box
  • You can style the close button
  • You can position the close button
  • You can style the background
If you don't like the close button, make your own

example7: Custom animations

Animations can be css or javascript. See the css file for the code.

Any animation you want

  • Different animations for show and hide.
  • You can also animate the overlay (show and hide also)

example7: Custom animations (part 2)

This example only uses javascript.

Any animation you want

Using 'show' and 'hideStart' event to call the wanted animations.

example8: Animation libraries

Thirdparty libraries can easily be used. Here is an example with animate.css library:
(show animation)
(hide animation)

This is a css animation

It uses the animate.css css library.
If you want to use JavaScript animations, you can easily plug it in using the 'show' and 'hideStart' events.

example9: Modal

Creating a modal popup is done by
  • disabling the overlay click
  • disabling the esc key binding
  • hiding the close button

Modal popup

  • Click on the background doesn't close
  • Default close button is hidden
  • Esc key not listened

example10: Prevent action

Show or hide a popup can be prevented when a condition is not met.

Check the checkbox

example11: Initializing multiple popup in one call

Initializing of multiple popup at once is done with jQuery selectors.
Hello one
Hello two

example12: Create dynamic box

You can create your popup box on the fly.
